text: Peter McNamara (5 July 1955 â€“ 20 July 2019) was an Australian tennis player and coach. McNamara won five singles titles and nineteen doubles titles in his career. He won the 1980 and 1982 men's doubles championship at Wimbledon and the Australian Open doubles in 1979. McNamara's highest rank in doubles was No. 3. He was born in Melbourne. McNamara died on 20 July 2019, at the age of 64, from prostate cancer in Sonthofen, Bavaria, Germany. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Australian Open champions Category:Australian tennis players Category:Cancer deaths in Germany Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Sportspeople from Melbourne Category:Wimbledon champions
title: Peter McNamara
